segments.text: How many people are in your family ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: As you know , China has a single-child policy . Therefore , there ’ s just my husband , my daughter and I . What about in your family ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I have one daughter and one son . Then there ’ s my husband and I . What about your parents ? Do they live with your family ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Not anymore . They live with my brother now . and yours ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: My parents live by themselves now . when they get older , they ’ ll probably go to a retirement home . Do you just have one brother ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No , I have two older brothers and one younger sister . What about you ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I also grew up in a big family . I have one older brother and three younger sisters .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: How long have you been married ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: About seven years now . and you ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I've been married for about five years . What do you think about divorce ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It ’ s becoming more and more common . However , I don ’ t ever want to get divorced myself ! What about you ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: If my husband cheated on me or treated me badly , I would get a divorce .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: If that happens , maybe you could marry my brother and we could become in-laws !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: ( ha ha ) I ’ ll keep that in mind , but don ’ t tell my husband .
segments.speaker: S2
